pages.text: To the foolish Entheator, Spells are among the most precious types knowledge; and they're not all wrong.$(br)Spells are indeed quite valuable, given the right chance. However, one must always be ready to accept the cost of such knowledge.$(br)In order to learn a Spell, a $(marked)Rite$() must be performed, usually. The Rite needed will differ from Spell to Spell.

The simple Spells known to us are recorded in this book, along with the Rite required to learn them.$(br)Learning a Spell will always scar the mind, though it's best to imagine those scars like engraved runes. This also makes forgetting a spell relatively difficult.$(br)There is a limit to how many spells the human mind can hold, which is why one should generally carefully select the spells they want to learn. $(br)The limit is generally described as seven Spells.

If a player wants to learn a Spell despite having reached their limit of seven spells, they will die in agony. If one wants to prevent this, it is best to first perform the Rite of the $(l:world/rites/rite_blank_slate)$(marked)Blank Slate$() to clear the mind.$(br)Once at least one Spell is known, spells can be selected by pressing $(l)$(k:miskmyst_up)$() or $(l)$(k:miskmyst_down)$(). This selection can be cancelled by pressing $(l)$(k:miskmyst_cancel)$().

pages.title: Casting Spells
pages.text: The selected spell can then be cast by pressing $(l)$(k:use)$(); this will start the $(marked)casting progress$(), which can be seen by the increasing saturation of the spell's icon; however, for the starting progress to begin, certain conditions will always be checked.$(br)These conditions differ with each Spell and are usually specified in the according entry.

Some spells will even do things as they are cast.$(br2)Additionally, whenever a caster starts casting a spell, the $(marked)price$() for casting that spell is immediately paid. This price is also usually specified in the according entry.$(br)Once the casting is finished, the Spell will take effect; however, if the Spell is canceled before by pressing $(l)$(k:miskmyst_cancel)$(), bad things, or nothing, may happen, depending on the Spell in question.

Similarly, bad-things-or-nothing may happen if the conditions for casting the spell - this includes material reagents - are not met.$(br2)Finally, once the Spell successfully takes effect, a cooldown will be applied, greying out the Spell's icon. The Spell may not be cast until this cooldown runs out.
